meanings.definition: To come together in a group or crowd.
meanings.sent1: The students will congregate in the library for their study group.
meanings.sent2: People often congregate at the park on weekends to enjoy the sunshine.
meanings.sent3: The birds congregate on the tree branches, chirping happily.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts of joy and laughter congregate in her mind like a colorful bouquet.
meanings.sent5: The stars congregate in the night sky, creating a mesmerizing display.

meanings.definition: To gather or assemble in one place.
meanings.sent1: Families congregate at the beach during the summer vacation.
meanings.sent2: Workers congregate in the break room during lunchtime.
meanings.sent3: Books of all genres congregate on the shelves of the bookstore.
meanings.sent4: Memories from the past congregate in her heart, filling it with warmth.
meanings.sent5: Clouds congregate in the sky, forming shapes that spark imagination.
